channel.title: [Photoshop] Fire Blur Text Effect [Tutorial]
channel.description:
[center]
[size=16pt][u][b]Fire Blur Text Effect Tutorial[/b][/u][/size]
[size=12pt]Welcome to my first tutorial! Today I am going to teach you how to put a Fire Blur Effect on your text in Photoshop. [/size]
[size=14pt] 1. First off open up Photoshop. Make your image as big as you want and make the background [b]black[/b].
2. Type in the text you want in any font and using the color white.[img]http://i584.photobucket.com/albums/ss285/Nightmare97/step2.jpg[/img]
3. Select your smudge tool.
[img]http://i584.photobucket.com/albums/ss285/Nightmare97/step3.jpg[/img]
4. Use the smudge tool on the outer parts of your text to make the "fire-like" effect shape. This is what your going for:
[img]http://i584.photobucket.com/albums/ss285/Nightmare97/step4.jpg[/img]
5. Now hit the button at the bottom right Create new adjustment layer > Color Balance. [img]http://i584.photobucket.com/albums/ss285/Nightmare97/step5.jpg[/img]
6. Under [b]Shadow[/b] put cyan to +70 and yellow to -70. Under [b]Midtones[/b] put cyan to +70 and yellow to -70 aswell. And Under [b]Highlights[/b] put cyan to +70 and yellow to -20. (You may have to mess around with the numbers till its what you're going for.)
[img]http://i584.photobucket.com/albums/ss285/Nightmare97/step6.jpg[/img]
And Congratulations, I hope I helped you learn something new! Please leave your results in the comments below! Also please tell me how the tutorial was . If it was sloppy, vague, etc. Thanks and good luck! [/size]
[/center]
